issue.title: [Java][Docs] Document how to use Flight artifacts
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-15917](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15917). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Flight artifacts require os-maven-plugin to resolve dependencies, we should include this in https://arrow.apache.org/docs/dev/java/install.html

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15917?focusedCommentId=17504943) by David Li (lidavidm):*
I attached an example pom (though ignore the part where the staging repo is configured)

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15917?focusedCommentId=17504953) by David Dali Susanibar Arce (dsusanibara):*
Yes, this is part of our [current recipe to build java cookbooks](https://github.com/apache/arrow-cookbook/blob/cb08c28165e6de748f508efea76fc0adcdd58d91/java/source/demo/pom.xml#L12-L19) 

 

My question here is, Is needed to add this procedure related to how to configure client project to use maven staging artifacts to our current documentation of java build night artifacts?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15917?focusedCommentId=17504962) by David Li (lidavidm):*
No, staging artifacts are rarely relevant and if we did document them, they should go as part of the release verification process. I'm just saying we should document the requirement on os-maven-plugin.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15917?focusedCommentId=17519051) by David Li (lidavidm):*
